reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought we’d try this hotel as Ardnamurchan is such an isolated spot there is very little choice of accommodation but past reviewers were right – the hotel needs investment , proper management and training and a lot of TLC. We didn’t go expecting four star standard but comfortable rooms and good service.
reviews.title: I should have listened to Trip Advisor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked two double rooms (one for my elderly mother). Hers was in the newer part of the hotel and was large with great views and a lovely bathroom. The other was dreary and depressing and in real need of renovation. The shower room and the door to the room were new but that was all. The curtain rail had to be seen to be believed. On arrival we wanted to relax with a cup of tea. The cartons of milk were like cheese and 'use by Dec 09' in both rooms! The heating wasn’t on in either room and when we asked for it to be turned on the radiators only became lukewarm at best – for the two days and nights we were there. We were supplied with heaters, one of which didn’t work.
reviews.title: Dont Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: On a positive note the manager/owner was helpful and friendly and the evening meals we had was good in front of a lovely open fire. Had our main course plates been cleared within half an hour on the second night we may have felt like a dessert but in the end we couldn’t face them any longer or wait for someone to clear. It wasn’t exactly busy either.
reviews.title: Hotel Prices & Appearance; Bunkhouse Service & Standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was another matter. The room was dingy and in urgent need of decoration with paper peeling off the walls. The cereal table offered individual cereal boxes, a bowl of muesli which was there 24/7 uncovered, orange squash, no fruit and a few slices of white bread in a basket for making your own toast. All tables were laid up for guests but some of the crockery and cutlery must have been there for days, if not weeks, gathering dust.
reviews.title: Really pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the second day we returned at about 4.30 to find the hotel door locked (it advertises for miles around as “open all day for food” ) and everywhere in darkness. We found a door to the bar unlocked and went to our rooms. One of the showers wasn’t working and we were told later that the dishwasher was probably on so as it fills it cuts off the water supply to our room above! Our rooms hadn’t been serviced and that evening we were told that was because we hadn’t left our keys behind – if we had we wouldn’t have been able to get in when staff were out.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the guest house, which is separate from the hotel and up a steep slope, and had self-contained accommodation, in a mix of family, twin and double rooms, all with en suite facilities. We often rent holiday houses for family get togethers, but this offered the added benefit of a hotel at the end of the drive with excellent, value for money food, and friendly and attentive service. Would highly recommend if location, atmosphere, family-friendly service, and value for money are important.
reviews.title: Great location for family get together

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Again tried it. What a disaster. A group of 4 holidaymakers waiting on one pot of tea for one of them, had to chase it up twice. We ordered two diet cokes and a pint, no diet coke. The last time no ice, time before that no crisps and no salad for the sandwiches. Come on get your act together. Clear the dirty tables that were lying covered in breakfast dishes at 2 in the afternoon. One poor soul on his own again at the bar. Is it laziness on the owners part or just the attitude of they're doing us a favour. I think not. What a shame to be let down again by nothing other than laziness. The poor boy serving nearly had a coronary when a bus full of European travellers stopped for a map reading or something and he thought they were coming in for drinks! Imagine they had. No Scottish hospitality here and no one to serve you except one poor soul on his own. Then to top it all the hotels dog peed at our feet - luckily we were outside on the decking. About sums it up tho.
reviews.title: Again tried it, didn't like it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is by far the best place to stay near Kilchoan, the location is absolutely stunning, staff friendly and attentive and the food (and views) in the modern bar was great. The room I had was nice and comfortable with the added bonus of being situated in the self catering annex, which gave me access to a living room and kitchen separate from my room.
reviews.title: Worth the drive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in fancier hotels, but everything about Sonachan was great. The bar itself had a very modern feel, with a good selection of drinks and a good choice of food, the food itself was excellent, very fresh and very reasonably priced. The rooms were also very comfortable and well finished, flat screen TV with freeview channels in the room and a great high pressure shower in the bathroom. It was a very laid back and friendly atmosphere, we were made to feel very much at home by Helen and the staff. The location is amazing with stunning views and only a 15 minute drive to Sanna and 5 minutes to Ardnamurchan Lighthouse. Another plus was the lack of a mobile phone signal!
reviews.title: Friendly, Informal, Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly but completely disorganised. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. Everything took ages to happen (e.g. at breakfast, it was over 40 minutes before even the first coffee or toast arrived). Whilst I suspect they were very short-staffed that day, this is no excuse for delivering the wrong food order. Food was nice when it finally arrived, but again took ages.
reviews.title: Disorganised and uncomfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sonachan Hotel is a warm and welcoming beacon set in the wilds of Ardnamurchan.
reviews.title: Welcoming, friendly, good food and good service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Arriving wet and tired after a tiring journey along the single track roads, we were ushered into the lounge with it's stove throwing out heat, and we soon felt warm and dry. A beautifully cooked Venison Casserole sorted us out for the rest of the evening.
reviews.title: Haste Ye Back because we will!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, obviously very new, was warm and comfortable and the en-suite bathroom was really well appointed. We were always welcomed every time we came in and in spite of some really wet weather, we had a lovely short holiday.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We know the area well as we have been coming for many years and we were delighted with the new changes to the Sonachan Hotel. The owner has worked to create a cosy and charming new cafe bar which is very welcoming after a long walk along Sanna Bay. We arrived on a rainy day and settled in front of the log burning stove to some good home made food. The service was friendly and the atmosphere was very relaxing, we felt in no hurry and were able to enjoy reading and relaxing after our meal.
reviews.title: Great location, but service and cleanliness somewhat lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We would recommend the Sonachan to those who are looking to relax and enjoy the highlands and its laid back pace of life. I am considering hosting my sons 30th birthday here.
reviews.title: Always worth a return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is absolutely stunning, and the cafe bar area is immaculately clean and is modern but still has a lovely atmosphere, food was all good and the service was friendly and warm yet informal which is definitely a good thing.
reviews.title: Lots of positives, but a couple of negatives, but overall good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall The Sonachan is a good bet to stay at, I can't comment on the hotel rooms as we were in the Band B annexe just up the hill(an easy walk) from the hotel, its a great idea with its own lounge area with magnificent views out across the croft land to the sea, and sunsets to die for. The room itself was spacious and clean a nd the ensuite was immaculately clean with a shower which had plenty hot water and reasonanle strength of power. The view from room 11 was exactly the same as the view from the lounge and was truly stunning. Here is the 1st of my negatives...the windows in the room and the lounge could have done with a clean....that's only a minor detail but the view was so spectacular and everything else so clean it seemed a shame.
reviews.title: Stunning location, but a little rough around the edges...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now the second of my negatives (and final it has to be said) we emailed to check our dog would be allowed in the bar area with us...we don't have kids and our dog is well behaved, sits quietly and would always be on a lead, we were told via email that yes he would be allowed in the upper portion of the bar/cafe near the pool table. We booked on this premise. Yet when we arrived we were told the hotels policy had now changed and dogs were now no longer allowed in any area.
reviews.title: Bruce's Birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 1st night this was no problem as we sat outside ant ate tea, which was tasty and a good portion size, but the 2nd night the weather was not so kind and we had to leave our dog in the car (something we try to avoid doing as it's his holiday too. And we sat inside, which is very nice, however we were subjected to a young child screaming and banging on the patio glass doors right next to where we sat(this was clearly not the fault of the hotel however I do have to wonder which scenario causes more upset our dog sitting quietly or screaming child?)
reviews.title: Brilliant night out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The lounge area in the B and B provided somewhere we could sit with our dog and enjoy the view, however if we had booked the actual hotel I am unsure what would have happened. It was more disappointment that we had been assured via email that he would be very welcome then arrived to find this was not the case.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Friendly staff, Will Be back!
